name: Regular Verbs: Past Tense Pronunciation
description: Master the three distinct sounds of the -ed ending (/ɪd/, /t/, and /d/) with independent word focus and phonetic verification.

cards.note:
**[180]**

Wanted (/ˈwɑːntɪd/)

Needed (/ˈniːdɪd/)

Decided (/dɪˈsaɪdɪd/)

[Wanted], [Needed], and [Decided] are type [/ɪd/ Sound].

**[180]**

Visited (/ˈvɪzɪtɪd/)

Started (/ˈstɑːrtɪd/)

Ended (/ˈɛndɪd/)

All verbs belong to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Attended (/əˈtɛndɪd/)

Added (/ˈædɪd/)

Waited (/ˈweɪtɪd/)

These verbs belong to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Worked (/wɜːrkt/)

Helped (/hɛlpt/)

Washed (/wɑːʃt/)

All verbs belong to the [/t/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Watched (/wɑːtʃt/)

Cooked (/kʊkt/)

Fixed (/fɪkst/)

All verbs belong to the [/t/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Laughed (/læft/)

Kissed (/kɪst/)

Brushed (/brʌʃt/)

These verbs belong to the [/t/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Played (/pleɪd/)

Called (/kɔːld/)

Cleaned (/kliːnd/)

All verbs belong to the [/d/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Loved (/lʌvd/)

Offered (/ˈɔːfərd/)

Enjoyed (/ɪnˈdʒɔɪd/)

All verbs belong to the [/d/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Lived (/lɪvd/)

Opened (/ˈoʊpənd/)

Used (/juːzd/)

These verbs belong to the [/d/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

Started (/ˈstɑːrtɪd/)

Worked (/wɜːrkt/)

Played (/pleɪd/)

[Started] is [/ɪd/ Sound], [Worked] is [/t/ Sound], and [Played] is [/d/ Sound].

**[180]**

Needed (/ˈniːdɪd/)

Fixed (/fɪkst/)

Called (/kɔːld/)

[Needed] is [/ɪd/ Sound], [Fixed] is [/t/ Sound], and [Called] is [/d/ Sound].

**[180]**

Visited (/ˈvɪzɪtɪd/)

Helped (/hɛlpt/)

Loved (/lʌvd/)

[Visited] is [/ɪd/ Sound], [Helped] is [/t/ Sound], and [Loved] is [/d/ Sound].

**[180]**

I added it yesterday. (/aɪ ˈædɪd ɪt ˈjɛstərdeɪ/)

The verb [added] belongs to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

We fixed that already. (/wi fɪkst ðæt ɔːlˈrɛdi/)

The verb [fixed] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

I called him later. (/aɪ kɔːld hɪm ˈleɪtər/)

The verb [called] belongs to the [/d/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

She washed it twice. (/ʃi wɑːʃt ɪt twaɪs/)

The verb [washed] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

I decided that on Monday. (/aɪ dɪˈsaɪdɪd ðæt ɑːn ˈmʌndeɪ/)

The verb [decided] belongs to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

They cleaned it all. (/ðeɪ kliːnd ɪt ɔːl/)

The verb [cleaned] belongs to the [/d/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

I helped them with that. (/aɪ hɛlpt ðɛm wɪð ðæt/)

The verb [helped] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA: We used it for the demo.

sideB.text: We used it for the demo.

cards.note:
**[180]**

We used it for the demo. (/wi juːzd ɪt fɔːr ðə ˈdɛmoʊ/)

The verb [used] belongs to the [/d/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

He started that project. (/hi ˈstɑːrtɪd ðæt ˈprɑːdʒɛkt/)

The verb [started] belongs to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

**[180]**

I watched it on TV. (/aɪ wɑːtʃt ɪt ɑːn ˌtiːˈviː/)

The verb [watched] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
I add it every day.
I added it yesterday.
cards.note:
**[180]**

I add it every day. (/aɪ æd ɪt ˈɛvri deɪ/)

I added it yesterday. (/aɪ ˈædɪd ɪt ˈjɛstərdeɪ/)

[Added] belongs to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
I need that now.
I needed that before.
cards.note:
**[180]**

I need that now. (/aɪ niːd ðæt naʊ/)

I needed that before. (/aɪ ˈniːdɪd ðæt bɪˈfɔːr/)

[Needed] belongs to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
We fix it often.
We fixed it already.
cards.note:
**[180]**

We fix it often. (/wi fɪks ɪt ˈɔːfən/)

We fixed it already. (/wi fɪkst ɪt ɔːlˈrɛdi/)

[Fixed] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
I help them today.
I helped them with that.
cards.note:
**[180]**

I help them today. (/aɪ hɛlp ðɛm təˈdeɪ/)

I helped them with that. (/aɪ hɛlpt ðɛm wɪð ðæt/)

[Helped] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
They call him now.
They called him later.
cards.note:
**[180]**

They call him now. (/ðeɪ kɔːl hɪm naʊ/)

They called him later. (/ðeɪ kɔːld hɪm ˈleɪtər/)

[Called] belongs to the [/d/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
I love that song.
I loved that movie.
cards.note:
**[180]**

I love that song. (/aɪ lʌv ðæt sɔːŋ/)

I loved that movie. (/aɪ lʌvd ðæt ˈmuːvi/)

[Loved] belongs to the [/d/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
We visit her weekly.
We visited her twice.
cards.note:
**[180]**

We visit her weekly. (/wi ˈvɪzɪt hər ˈwiːkli/)

We visited her twice. (/wi ˈvɪzɪtɪd hər twaɪs/)

[Visited] belongs to the [/ɪd/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
I wash it tonight.
I washed it twice.
cards.note:
**[180]**

I wash it tonight. (/aɪ wɑːʃ ɪt təˈnaɪt/)

I washed it twice. (/aɪ wɑːʃt ɪt twaɪs/)

[Washed] belongs to the [/t/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
They clean it all.
They cleaned it all.
cards.note:
**[180]**

They clean it all. (/ðeɪ kliːn ɪt ɔːl/)

They cleaned it all. (/ðeɪ kliːnd ɪt ɔːl/)

[Cleaned] belongs to the [/d/ Sound] group.

cards.sideA:
We use it daily.
We used it for the demo.

sideB.text: We used it for the demo.

cards.note:
**[180]**

We use it daily. (/wi juːz ɪt ˈdeɪli/)

We used it for the demo. (/wi juːzd ɪt fɔːr ðə ˈdɛmoʊ/)
